articles.title: Trump Touts Rare-Earth Win in Talks That Showed Xi’s Strong Hand - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Donald Trump sounded triumphant afterwards. But in his first meeting with Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping since returning to office in January, the US president had to give at least as much as he got.

articles.title: Amazon’s stock soars toward its best day since 2022: ‘The AI narrative has flipped positive’ - MarketWatch

articles.description: China and the U.S. reached a trade truce, de-escalating tensions that had threatened to push the world's two largest economies into a full-blown trade war.

articles.title: Massive OpenAI data center planned for farmland near Ann Arbor - The Detroit News
articles.description: The "hyperscale" data center is expected to be huge, requiring 25% more energy than DTE Energy Co. currently provides to its customers.

articles.description: Apple's revenue and EPS exceeded estimates, but iPhone revenue and China sales missed expectations. Tim Cook talked AI and more in an earnings call.

articles.title: Amazon's CEO says its 14,000 job cuts weren't driven by costs or AI: 'It's about culture' - Business Insider
articles.description: CEO Andy Jassy clarifies Amazon's 14,000 job cuts were due to cultural misalignment, not cost or AI.

articles.title: US Futures Rise on Tech Results After Downbeat Day: Markets Wrap - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Asian equities climbed close to their record and US equity-index futures advanced as strong earnings from Amazon.com Inc. and Apple Inc. lifted sentiment after a brief pause in the global stock rally.

articles.title: CoreWeave Terminates Core Scientific Deal After Shareholders Reject Offer - Investor's Business Daily
articles.description: CoreWeave stock fell after the "neocloud" terminated its acquisition of Core Scientific after its shareholders rejected a merger offer.

articles.title: Navan IPO tumbles 20% after historic debut under SEC shutdown workaround - TechCrunch
articles.description: Navan finished its first day trading at an approximate valuation of $4.7 billion, which is about half of its last private valuation of $9.2 billion.

articles.description: The lone analyst with a sell rating on Fiserv Inc. ahead of the company’s crushing stock selloff says the writing was on the wall for months.
